messages.message: Bumping... I think this would be an amazing value-add today and moving forward.

Also, if we do elect to use an upstream integration solution w/ recurring runs instead of a stub resource (my preference is for the latter), I can meet with whoever configures that and create a demo* for future shared org spaces and using videos/scribes.
• Note*: I would attempt to create it in-platform given the time, but I don't have any company S3 buckets (or upstream integratable (is this a word?) cloud storage drives) to use. Also, I think the stubby solution is better for future demos/testing (including advancements updates)
Hmm, stubby solution is probably less time consuming tbh. Its fine if its static?
Is it possible to be a little bit interactive? (like slidey slidey, clicky clicky?)
yah, static is the wrong word. I just mean does it need to work for every deployment or can it be mock data with mock classes that shows up always?

I think that would be okay! 

If it's not too much, sounds like there is potential to have different presets to highlight scenarios: 
• Balanced/ideal automation
• Extremes (high automation rate, lower accuracy)
• Etc
Okay I'll make a ticket for this. I don't think I can get to it immediately but since you're saying it is def a value-add I'll try to get to it soon!

Thank you!! And while admittedly I haven't shown it lately, I've gotten (or otherwise heard) several requests for demos around deployment metrics (and thinking ahead for future enablement, it seems like it could be a helpful asset, maybe even paving the way for similar solutions to other metrics)
Yes static would help the SEs. @Jasper was asking about this the other day also
